description: Retention of use of property as 10 x one-bedroom self-contained flats
decision_conditions: It is evident that the flats were not in residential use at the date of the application and have not been for close to a year before the date of the application. The break in the use is significant, for which no explanation is provided therefore the applicant has not discharged the burden of proof, that at the time the application was made the use was lawful. Refuse Certificate of Lawfulness of existing operation/use

Section 59 of the Highways Act permits the Highway Authority to charge developers for damage caused by excessive weight and movements of vehicles to and from a site. The Highway Authority will pass on the cost of any excess repairs compared to normal maintenance costs to the applicant/organisation responsible for the damage.

Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.Validation requirement 1d.Please note that the submitted plan is to incorrect scale and the complete site should be outlined in red, not just the building.
